Barcelona's Rafinha Suffered A Grim Injury Against Athletic Bilbao Sat Feb 04 2017 23:05:50 GMT+0000 (GMT) Sat Feb 04 2017 23:05:50 GMT+0000 (GMT) Josh Lawless Josh Lawless in football 
Barcelona followed up their 2-1 Copa Del Rey quarter final first leg win over Atletico Madrid in midweek with a comfortable 3-0 win over Athletic Bilbao at the Nou Camp. 
Paco Alcacer, Lionel Messi and Aleix Vidal were all on the scoresheet in what was a smooth day's work for the Blaugrana. 
The only real issue was the injury suffered by Rafinha Alcantara, who had to be taken off shortly after half-time. 
The attacker has only just returned from a hamstring injury lay-off and though this one was an impact injury as opposed to a muscle problem, it looked incredibly painful. 
The Brazilian had to have 12 stitches after the deep gash on his head. 
It's not for the squeamish, but you can see a picture of the injury here: Rafinha's injury from today's game looks a bit painful :flushed::flushed::flushed: pic.twitter.com/7fNS9XkvQ6 - Footy Accumulators (@FootyAccums) February 4, 2017 
Barca fans weren't too happy, given that he's only just come back from injury. 
Speedy recovery, Rafinha! - Sameer Riyaz (@SameerRiyaz13) February 4, 2017 what do i need to do to make sure rafinha doesn't suffer some form of injury every goddamn time he's playing well pic.twitter.com/nkN63cQ7y8
